question.title: How to enable NetBeans settings to build SWT-based applications
question.body:
I am trying to compile this simple code:

import org.eclipse.swt.SWT;
import org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display;
import org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell;
import org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Label;
import org.eclipse.swt.layout.FillLayout;

public class HelloWorldSWT {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Display display = new Display();
        Shell shell = new Shell(display);
        shell.setText("Mi Primera App SWT");
        shell.setLayout(new FillLayout());
        Label label = new Label(shell, SWT.CENTER);
        label.setText("Â¡Hola, Mundo SWT!");
        shell.pack();
        shell.open();

        while (!shell.isDisposed()) {
            if (!display.readAndDispatch()) {
                display.sleep();
            }
        }

        display.dispose();
    }
}

with the swt-4.36-gtk-linux-x86_64 latest release but all I get is in spite of I added the org.eclipse.swt library with the /home/asarch/NetBeansProjects/swt-4.36-gtk-linux-x86_64/swt.jar classpath file:

--- compiler:3.13.0:compile (default-compile) @ HelloWorldSWT ---
Recompiling the module because of changed source code.
Compiling 1 source file with javac [debug release 24] to target/classes
-------------------------------------------------------------
COMPILATION ERROR : 
-------------------------------------------------------------
HelloWorldSWT.java:[9,23] package org.eclipse.swt does not exist
HelloWorldSWT.java:[10,31] package org.eclipse.swt.widgets does not exist
HelloWorldSWT.java:[11,31] package org.eclipse.swt.widgets does not exist
HelloWorldSWT.java:[12,31] package org.eclipse.swt.widgets does not exist
HelloWorldSWT.java:[13,30] package org.eclipse.swt.layout does not exist
HelloWorldSWT.java:[19,9] cannot find symbol

[Help 1] http://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/MojoFailureException

using Apache NetBeans 26

Here is pom.xml:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
    <groupId>com.mycompany</groupId>
    <artifactId>HelloWorldSWT</artifactId>
    <version>1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
    <packaging>jar</packaging>
    <properties>
        <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
        <maven.compiler.release>24</maven.compiler.release>
        <exec.mainClass>HelloWorldSWT</exec.mainClass>
    </properties>
</project>

question_comments.body: The SWT Home Page has details of Maven Artifacts
This answer looks like it is probably the correct one this days. Current SWT version is 3.130.0

The project seems to be built with Maven. Share the pom.xml. In general you are expected to provide a minimal reproducible example in Stack Overflow questions. If you added a jar to a Netbeans project that probably explains that Maven doesn't see it.
